description: From Latin dehiscentem, present participle of dehiscō (“I divide, split open, gape”), from hiscō (“I yawn, gape”).

adjectives.description: dehiscent (comparative more dehiscent, superlative most dehiscent)

entries.meaning: (medicine) Of or pertaining to dehiscence, i.e., a rupture, as with a surgical wound opening up, often with a flow of serous fluid
